pr_title: fix issue with group by limit pushdown for extractionFn, expressions, joins, etc

timeline.message: fix issue with group by limit pushdown for extractionFn, expressions, joins, etc

timeline.bodyText: IMO it's more elegant if this method doesn't exist, and the caller does the allMatch.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText:
canDoLimitPushDown would be a better name for two reasons:

There's other stuff that can be pushed down, in general, other than limits.
Spelling of PushDown is more consistent with the methods on GroupByQuery itself.
timeline.author: gianm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -555,7 +557,17 @@ public HashAggregateIterator(
       final DefaultLimitSpec limitSpec = query.isApplyLimitPushDown() &&
                                          querySpecificConfig.isApplyLimitPushDownToSegment() ?
                                          (DefaultLimitSpec) query.getLimitSpec() : null;
+
+
+      boolean canDoPushdown = false;

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't seem right. The only place using DEFAULT_STRING_CAPABILITIES is getEffectiveCapabilities in this same file. And looking at the cases in that method, each one seems like it should behave a bit differently. So consider deleting this constant and having the getEffectiveCapabilities should be generating various capabilities objects.
timeline.author: gianm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,6 +61,8 @@ private DimensionHandlerUtils()
   public static final ColumnCapabilities DEFAULT_STRING_CAPABILITIES =
       new ColumnCapabilitiesImpl().setType(ValueType.STRING)
                                   .setDictionaryEncoded(true)
+                                  .setDictionaryValuesUnique(true)

timeline.bodyText: nit: IMO Capable is a nicer name than IsCapable.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText: The dictionary value is just the row number. They aren't sorted.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText: Would be good to have javadocs here.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText: Would be good for these comments to be capitalized properly and have sentence-ending punctuation.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText: This comment isn't adding much, it's just repeating the couple of lines below it in English. I'd either delete it, or replace it with a comment that adds information by explaining why this fact is the case.
timeline.author: gianm

timeline.bodyText: Bitmap indexes aren't required here. I don't think it hurts too much to have in practice this check here, since in the primary case where pushdown matters (direct access to a column in a regular segment) bitmap indexes will be there. But it isn't necessary.
timeline.author: gianm
